NAME

VulnEmail - Takes in a user/email, combines all new vulns based on their app/version criteria and sends email

   1 
   2 package VulnEmail;
   3 
   4 use 5.008;
   5 use strict;
   6 use warnings;
   7 use Carp;
   8 
   9 our $VERSION = '0.01';
  10 
  11 sub new {
  12     #In: (username or email) and messages arrayref
  13     my $class   = shift;
  14     my $args    = shift;
  15     my $msgs_ref    = $args->{msgs} || [];
  16     my $email   = $args->{email} || '';
  17     my $username= $args->{username} || '';
  18 
  19     my $self    = { msgs => $msgs_ref, email => $email, username => $username, email => '' };
  20 
  21     
  22     bless $self, $class;
  23 
  24 }
  25 
  26 
  27 sub format_as_html {
  28     #In: arrayref of messages
  29     #Do: format message subjects/bodies into html (basically just text with an html index of subjects)
  30     #Out: email text scalar
  31 
  32     my $self = shift;
  33     my @msgs = @{$self->{msgs}};
  34 
  35     my ($email_html, $email_text) = '';
  36 
  37     $email_html .= ("<a href='http://localhost/vulntracker/messages/" . $_->id . "'> " . $_->subject . "</a> <br /> <br /> \n") for (@msgs);
  38 
  39     $self->{email} = $email_html
  40 
  41 
  42 }
  43 
  44 sub send_email {
  45     #In: email, subject, and body scalars in a hash ref
  46     #Do: send email
  47     #Out: none
  48 
  49     open my $logfile, ">>", "logs/logfile.txt";
  50     my $self    = shift;
  51     my $args    = shift;
  52     my $subject = $args->{subject} || '';
  53     my $email   = $args->{email};
  54     my $body   = $args->{body} || '';
  55 
  56     if (not $email) { croak "email arg is required" }
  57 
  58     eval {
  59         use MIME::Lite;
  60 
  61         my $msg = MIME::Lite->new(
  62             Subject => $subject,
  63             From    => 'no-reply@advisoryscan.net',
  64             To      => $email,
  65             Type    => 'text/html',
  66             Data    => $body,
  67         );
  68         $msg->send();
  69     };
  70     if ($@) {
  71         my $cur_datetime = localtime();
  72         print $logfile $cur_datetime . ": " . $@ . "\n";
  73     }
  74 }
  75 
  76 1;
  77 
  78
